Company Leave Policy

Purpose
The purpose of this leave policy is to provide employees with time off from work for rest, personal matters, illness, and other life events while ensuring smooth business operations.

Annual Leave
Employees are entitled to 24 days of paid annual leave per calendar year. Annual leave accrues monthly and must be approved by the reporting manager. Unused leave may be carried forward up to a maximum of 10 days.

Sick Leave
Employees are entitled to 12 days of sick leave per year. Sick leave can be used in case of illness or medical emergencies. Medical certificates are required for absences exceeding two consecutive working days.

Casual Leave
Casual leave of up to 6 days per year may be taken for personal matters. Casual leave cannot be carried forward to the next year.

Maternity Leave
Female employees are entitled to 26 weeks of paid maternity leave as per government regulations. Adoption leave of 12 weeks is also provided.

Paternity Leave
Male employees are entitled to 10 working days of paternity leave, which must be used within three months of childbirth.

Leave Without Pay
If all leave balances are exhausted, leave without pay may be approved at managementâ€™s discretion.

Leave Approval Process
All leave requests must be submitted through the HR portal at least 3 days in advance, except in emergencies.
Employee Code of Conduct

Professional Behavior
Employees must conduct themselves in a professional manner at all times. Harassment, discrimination, or abusive behavior will not be tolerated.

Conflict of Interest
Employees must avoid situations where personal interests conflict with company interests. Any potential conflicts must be disclosed to management.

Confidentiality
Employees must not disclose confidential company information to external parties without proper authorization.

Workplace Ethics
Bribery, corruption, or unethical business practices are strictly prohibited.

Disciplinary Action
Violation of this code may result in disciplinary action including termination of employment.
Information Security Policy

Objective
This policy defines the guidelines for protecting company information assets from unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, or destruction.

Access Control
Access to company systems must be granted based on the principle of least privilege. Employees must not share passwords or authentication credentials with anyone.

Data Classification
Company data is classified into Public, Internal, Confidential, and Restricted categories. Restricted data must be encrypted both at rest and in transit.

Acceptable Use
Company systems must only be used for authorized business purposes. Installing unauthorized software is strictly prohibited.

Incident Management
Any suspected security incident must be reported to the IT security team within 24 hours. Failure to report incidents may result in disciplinary action.

Remote Work Security
Employees working remotely must use company-approved VPNs and ensure devices are protected with updated antivirus software.

Compliance
All employees must comply with this policy. Non-compliance may lead to termination or legal action.
